content:
Today, the Senate Armed Services Committee held a hearing on the withdrawal of U.S. and Coalition forces from Afghanistan, which I’ve made clear I think is a big mistake.

After asking our witnesses about the progress that’s been made with the Taliban and the steps we’ve taken to protect Afghans who aided our troops over there, I’ve got to say — I’m not very comforted.

Read a transcript of my Q&A here: https://www.inhofe.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/inhofe-at-afghanistan-hearing-i-dont-get-a-lot-of-comfort-out-of-those-answers
name: James M. Inhofe
text: today senate armed services committee held hearing withdrawal us coalition forces afghanistan ive made clear think big mistakeafter asking witnesses progress thats made taliban steps weve taken protect afghans aided troops ive got say im comfortedread transcript qa

content:
My office is hosting a virtual "Service Academy Day" for students and parents interested in learning more about the five Military Service Academies and how to apply to them. Representatives from each academy will also be attending.

Register here: eventbrite.com/e/all-academy-… https://t.co/aRzOB62NOA

content:
We have made tremendous progress in the national effort to immunize Americans against COVID-19, but our work is far from over.

We must build trust in the safety and efficacy of COVID-19 vaccines and encourage unvaccinated Americans to get their shots. That’s why our Oversight & Investigations Subcommittee is holding a hearing next week on vaccine confidence so all Americans can take advantage of these lifesaving vaccines. WATCH the hearing here: bit.ly/3hG5mA7

NYTIMES.COM
Vaccinations sharply cut the spread of the virus in U.S. nursing homes, study says.
name: Energy and Commerce Committee
text: made tremendous progress national effort immunize americans covid19 work far overwe must build trust safety efficacy covid19 vaccines encourage unvaccinated americans get shots thats oversight investigations subcommittee holding hearing next week vaccine confidence americans take advantage lifesaving vaccines watch hearing bitly3hg5ma7nytimescomvaccinations sharply cut spread virus us nursing homes study says
